trans-unit.source: Create a virtual machine running MySQL in Azure
trans-unit.target: Create a virtual machine running MySQL in Azure

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure virtual machine running Windows Server 2012 R2, and then install and configure the MySQL database on it.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure virtual machine running Windows Server 2012 R2, and then install and configure the MySQL database on it.

trans-unit.source: Install MySQL on a virtual machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 in Azure
trans-unit.target: Install MySQL on a virtual machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 in Azure

trans-unit.source: [MySQL](http://www.mysql.com) is a popular open source, SQL database.
trans-unit.target: [MySQL](http://www.mysql.com) is a popular open source, SQL database.

trans-unit.source: Using the [Azure portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com), you can create a virtual machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 from the Image Gallery.
trans-unit.target: Using the [Azure portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com), you can create a virtual machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 from the Image Gallery.

trans-unit.source: You can then install and configure it as a MySQL Server.
trans-unit.target: You can then install and configure it as a MySQL Server.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on installing MySQL on Linux, refer to: [How to install MySQL on Azure](virtual-machines-linux-install-mysql.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on installing MySQL on Linux, refer to: [How to install MySQL on Azure](virtual-machines-linux-install-mysql.md).

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to:

trans-unit.source: Use the Azure portal to create a virtual machine running Windows Server 2012 R2.
trans-unit.target: Use the Azure portal to create a virtual machine running Windows Server 2012 R2.

trans-unit.source: Install and run the community version of MySQL 5.6.23 as a MySQL Server on the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Install and run the community version of MySQL 5.6.23 as a MySQL Server on the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Create a virtual machine running Windows Server
trans-unit.target: Create a virtual machine running Windows Server

trans-unit.source: Attach a data disk
trans-unit.target: Attach a data disk

trans-unit.source: After the virtual machine is created, you can optionally attach an additional data disk.
trans-unit.target: After the virtual machine is created, you can optionally attach an additional data disk.

trans-unit.source: This is recommended for production workloads and to avoid running out of space on the OS drive (C:), which includes the operating system.
trans-unit.target: This is recommended for production workloads and to avoid running out of space on the OS drive (C:), which includes the operating system.

trans-unit.source: See [How to attach a data disk to a Windows virtual machine](storage-windows-attach-disk.md) and follow the instructions for attaching an empty disk.
trans-unit.target: See [How to attach a data disk to a Windows virtual machine](storage-windows-attach-disk.md) and follow the instructions for attaching an empty disk.

trans-unit.source: Set the host cache setting to **None** or **Read-only**.
trans-unit.target: Set the host cache setting to **None** or **Read-only**.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Log on to the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Next, you'll log on to the virtual machine so you can install MySQL.
trans-unit.target: Next, you'll log on to the virtual machine so you can install MySQL.

trans-unit.source: Install and run MySQL Community Server on the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Install and run MySQL Community Server on the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to install, configure, and run the Community version of MySQL Server:
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to install, configure, and run the Community version of MySQL Server:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] These steps are for the 5.6.23.0 Community version of MySQL and Windows Server 2012 R2.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] These steps are for the 5.6.23.0 Community version of MySQL and Windows Server 2012 R2.

trans-unit.source: Your experience might be different for different versions of MySQL or Windows Server.
trans-unit.target: Your experience might be different for different versions of MySQL or Windows Server.

trans-unit.source: After you've connected to the virtual machine using Remote Desktop, click **Internet Explorer** from the start screen.
trans-unit.target: After you've connected to the virtual machine using Remote Desktop, click **Internet Explorer** from the start screen.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Tools** button in the upper-right corner (the cogged wheel icon), and then click **Internet Options**.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Tools** button in the upper-right corner (the cogged wheel icon), and then click **Internet Options**.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Security** tab, click the **Trusted Sites** icon, and then click the **Sites** button.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Security** tab, click the **Trusted Sites** icon, and then click the **Sites** button.

trans-unit.source: Add http://*.mysql.com to the list of trusted sites.
trans-unit.target: Add http://*.mysql.com to the list of trusted sites.

trans-unit.source: Click **Close**, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Close**, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: In the address bar of Internet Explorer, type http://dev.mysql.com/downloads/mysql/.
trans-unit.target: In the address bar of Internet Explorer, type http://dev.mysql.com/downloads/mysql/.

trans-unit.source: Use the MySQL site to locate and download the latest version of the MySQL Installer for Windows.
trans-unit.target: Use the MySQL site to locate and download the latest version of the MySQL Installer for Windows.

trans-unit.source: When choosing the MySQL Installer, download the version that has the complete file set (for example, the mysql-installer-community-5.6.23.0.msi with a file size of 282.4 MB), and save the installer file to the Windows desktop.
trans-unit.target: When choosing the MySQL Installer, download the version that has the complete file set (for example, the mysql-installer-community-5.6.23.0.msi with a file size of 282.4 MB), and save the installer file to the Windows desktop.

trans-unit.source: From the desktop, double-click the installer file to begin installation.
trans-unit.target: From the desktop, double-click the installer file to begin installation.

trans-unit.source: On the **License Agreement** page, accept the license agreement and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **License Agreement** page, accept the license agreement and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Choosing a Setup Type** page, click the setup type that you want, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Choosing a Setup Type** page, click the setup type that you want, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: The following steps assume the selection of the **Server only** setup type.
trans-unit.target: The following steps assume the selection of the **Server only** setup type.

trans-unit.source: On the **Installation** page, click **Execute**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Installation** page, click **Execute**.

trans-unit.source: When installation is complete, click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: When installation is complete, click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Product Configuration** page, click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Product Configuration** page, click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Type and Networking** page, specify your desired configuration type and connectivity options, including the TCP port if needed.
trans-unit.target: On the **Type and Networking** page, specify your desired configuration type and connectivity options, including the TCP port if needed.

trans-unit.source: Select **Show Advanced Options**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Show Advanced Options**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Accounts and Roles** page, specify a strong MySQL root password.
trans-unit.target: On the **Accounts and Roles** page, specify a strong MySQL root password.

trans-unit.source: Add additional MySQL user accounts as needed, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Add additional MySQL user accounts as needed, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Windows Service** page, specify changes to the default settings for running the MySQL Server as a Windows service as needed, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Windows Service** page, specify changes to the default settings for running the MySQL Server as a Windows service as needed, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Advanced Options** page, specify changes to logging options as needed, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Advanced Options** page, specify changes to logging options as needed, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Apply Server Configuration** page, click **Execute**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Apply Server Configuration** page, click **Execute**.

trans-unit.source: When the configuration steps are complete, click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: When the configuration steps are complete, click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Product Configuration** page, click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Product Configuration** page, click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Installation Complete** page, click **Copy Log to Clipboard** if you want to examine it later, and then click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Installation Complete** page, click **Copy Log to Clipboard** if you want to examine it later, and then click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: From the start screen, type **mysql**, and then click **MySQL 5.6 Command Line Client**.
trans-unit.target: From the start screen, type **mysql**, and then click **MySQL 5.6 Command Line Client**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the root password that you specified in step 11 and you'll be presented with a prompt where you can issue commands to configure MySQL.
trans-unit.target: Enter the root password that you specified in step 11 and you'll be presented with a prompt where you can issue commands to configure MySQL.

trans-unit.source: For the details of commands and syntax, see [MySQL Reference Manuals](http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/server-configuration-defaults.html).
trans-unit.target: For the details of commands and syntax, see [MySQL Reference Manuals](http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/server-configuration-defaults.html).

trans-unit.source: You can also configure server configuration default settings, such as the base and data directories and drives, with entries in the C:\Program Files (x86)\MySQL\MySQL Server 5.6\my-default.ini file.
trans-unit.target: You can also configure server configuration default settings, such as the base and data directories and drives, with entries in the C:\Program Files (x86)\MySQL\MySQL Server 5.6\my-default.ini file.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [5.1.2 Server Configuration Defaults](http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/server-configuration-defaults.html).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [5.1.2 Server Configuration Defaults](http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/server-configuration-defaults.html).

trans-unit.source: If you want the MySQL Server service to be available to MySQL client computers on the Internet, you must configure an endpoint for the TCP port on which the MySQL Server service is listening and create an additional Windows Firewall rule.
trans-unit.target: If you want the MySQL Server service to be available to MySQL client computers on the Internet, you must configure an endpoint for the TCP port on which the MySQL Server service is listening and create an additional Windows Firewall rule.

trans-unit.source: This is TCP port 3306 unless you specified a different port on the **Type and Networking** page (step 10 of the previous procedure).
trans-unit.target: This is TCP port 3306 unless you specified a different port on the **Type and Networking** page (step 10 of the previous procedure).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You should carefully consider the security implications of doing this, because this will make the MySQL Server service available to all computers on the Internet.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You should carefully consider the security implications of doing this, because this will make the MySQL Server service available to all computers on the Internet.

trans-unit.source: You can define the set of source IP addresses that are allowed to use the endpoint with an Access Control List (ACL).
trans-unit.target: You can define the set of source IP addresses that are allowed to use the endpoint with an Access Control List (ACL).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to Set Up Endpoints to a Virtual Machine](virtual-machines-set-up-endpoints.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to Set Up Endpoints to a Virtual Machine](virtual-machines-set-up-endpoints.md).

trans-unit.source: To configure an endpoint for the MySQL Server service:
trans-unit.target: To configure an endpoint for the MySQL Server service:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, click **Virtual Machines**, click the name of your MySQL virtual machine, and then click **Endpoints**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, click **Virtual Machines**, click the name of your MySQL virtual machine, and then click **Endpoints**.

trans-unit.source: In the command bar, click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the command bar, click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Add an endpoint to a virtual machine** page, click the right arrow.
trans-unit.target: On the **Add an endpoint to a virtual machine** page, click the right arrow.

trans-unit.source: If you are using the default MySQL TCP port of 3306, click **MySQL** in **Name**, and then click the check mark.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the default MySQL TCP port of 3306, click **MySQL** in **Name**, and then click the check mark.

trans-unit.source: If you are using a different TCP port, type a unique name in **Name**.
trans-unit.target: If you are using a different TCP port, type a unique name in **Name**.

trans-unit.source: Select **TCP** in protocol, type the port number in both **Public Port** and **Private Port**, and then click the check mark.
trans-unit.target: Select **TCP** in protocol, type the port number in both **Public Port** and **Private Port**, and then click the check mark.

trans-unit.source: To add a Windows Firewall rule that allows MySQL traffic from the Internet, run the following command at an administrator-level Windows PowerShell command prompt on the MySQL server computer.
trans-unit.target: To add a Windows Firewall rule that allows MySQL traffic from the Internet, run the following command at an administrator-level Windows PowerShell command prompt on the MySQL server computer.

trans-unit.source: To test your remote connection to the MySQL Server service running on the Azure virtual machine, you must first determine the DNS name corresponding to the cloud service that contains the virtual machine running MySQL Server.
trans-unit.target: To test your remote connection to the MySQL Server service running on the Azure virtual machine, you must first determine the DNS name corresponding to the cloud service that contains the virtual machine running MySQL Server.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, click **Virtual Machines**, click the name of your MySQL server virtual machine, and then click **Dashboard**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, click **Virtual Machines**, click the name of your MySQL server virtual machine, and then click **Dashboard**.

trans-unit.source: From the virtual machine dashboard, note the **DNS Name** value under the **Quick Glance** section.
trans-unit.target: From the virtual machine dashboard, note the **DNS Name** value under the **Quick Glance** section.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example:

trans-unit.source: From a local computer running MySQL or the MySQL client, run the following command to log in as a MySQL user.
trans-unit.target: From a local computer running MySQL or the MySQL client, run the following command to log in as a MySQL user.

trans-unit.source: For example, for the MySQL user name dbadmin3 and the testmysql.cloudapp.net DNS name for the virtual machine, use the following command.
trans-unit.target: For example, for the MySQL user name dbadmin3 and the testmysql.cloudapp.net DNS name for the virtual machine, use the following command.

trans-unit.source: Additional resources
trans-unit.target: Additional resources

trans-unit.source: For information on MySQL, see the [MySQL Documentation](http://dev.mysql.com/doc/).
trans-unit.target: For information on MySQL, see the [MySQL Documentation](http://dev.mysql.com/doc/).
